message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest spinal stenosis, and X-rays confirm degenerative changes. MRI scans are the most appropriate diagnostic tool for spinal stenosis. Measurement of HLA-B27 antigen is used to diagnose ankylosing spondylitis, which is not likely in this case. Measurement of the ankle brachial index is used to diagnose peripheral artery disease, which is not likely the cause of the patient’s symptoms. Polysomnography is used to diagnose sleep disorders, which are not likely related to the patient’s lower extremity pain.

The most appropriate next step in diagnosis would be an MRI scan of the spine to visualize the stenosis more accurately. Measurement of HLA-B27 antigen is used for diagnosing ankylosing spondylitis. Measurement of the ankle brachial index is useful in evaluating peripheral arterial disease, which is not the most likely diagnosis in this case. Polysomnography is used to diagnose sleep disorders and is not relevant to the patient’s symptoms.
